subject: RE: [junit] Re: Jwebunit Question
msgSnippet: Hi Poornima, I think u got my problem.. Initially I was testing a sample jsp page now I have modify my program according to my proj req... So now what problem
messageBody:
Hi Poornima,



I think u got my problem..

Initially I was testing a sample jsp page now I have modify my program
according to my proj req...



So now what problem I m facing is..



I have set my base url & then tryinh to access the home page of my
application by passing rest url in beginAt() method..

Now program is reaching to its exact home jsp page but..still I m
getting an exception:



java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out: connect



I don't know why this is happening & u have written something abt
HttpDialog which I m not using till now..

So is it mandatory to use..?



Let me know if u required my code to c



Thanks a lot,

Richa.



________________________________

From: Nima Mallur [mailto:nimamallur@...]
Sent: Wednesday, November 16, 2005 11:21 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Re: Jwebunit Question



Hello,
after you set the context url.Is your site built on relative url or
hardcoded url in the page.
if it is relative url then u can just have url = "http://localhost
and then tester.neginAt("/");
Adn then get the response using the HttpDialog on the tester object and
then
from the response make sure that specific form is present and make that
form
active and then get all the elements/parameters from that form and then
u
can try to assert if that specific form elemnt is present and then go
ahead
with assigning the values for that element.
Let me know if u come across any problems
Bye
Godo luck
Poornima

On 11/12/05, richa_gwrl <richaa@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
> I am new to JWebUnit & trying to use it for my jsp pages.
> But I am getting "AssertionFailedError" with message "No form
> present."
> I m using following code lines to set page & form elemnts method:
>
> getTestContext().setBaseUrl("http://localhost:8080/test");
>
> beginAt("sample.jsp");
>
> assertFormElementPresent("login");
>
> any help would be highly appreciated.
>
> I m not having any good stuff on this topic so I can't do any R&D
> for the code...
>
>
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "lusujin2002" <lusujin2002@y...> wrote:
> >
> > I'm currently trying to use jwebunit for one of my webapplicatins.
> > And encountering an issue with the clickLinkWithText method.
> >
> > The problem is that, upon clicking the link, I suspect that it does
> > not go to the next page.
> >
> > This is my code snippets:
> > assertLinkPresentWithText("Next");
> > clickLinkWithText("Next");
> > assertTitleEquals("New Page Title");
> >
> > What happens after this is that the assertTitle fails as it
> displays
> > the old previous page's title.
> >
> > I have checked my web application and the links exists.
> >
> > Any clues on this strange issue?
> >
> > Thanks in advance.
> >
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>

>
>
>
>
>
>
